channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brook Gate @ Park Lane turning, defunct red signage needs to be removed as street clutter. Crossrail which is thw directional sign was opened 3 years ago., 7th November
item.description:
Defunct red directional sign @ Brook Gate on Parl Lane. Please remove sign as street clutter .Thank you.

item.title: Rubbish on the pavement, 7th November
item.description:
I would like to report excess rubbish and leaves and do waste along the road which need to be cleaned up. The road is neglected with the excessive, waste bins, scaffolding and leaves along the road and taking up the path. I pay council tax for what??

item.title: Concern About Parked Vehicle on Church Crescent with People Living In It, 7th November
item.description:
A red bulky van has been parked on Church Crescent for over two weeks without moving. It seems that individuals are living in it, and there is a strong smell of cannabis coming from it. It is causing concern and making residents feel unsafe.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Church Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unwanted bikes outside my window, 7th November
item.description:

item.title: Chester Gardens opposite No 49, at the entrance to the garages, 7th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chester Gardens, Southbury, London

item.title: Loose drain cover on roundabout, 7th November
item.description:
The drain cover on this roundabout is loose yet again every time my car goes over. It makes a huge crushing sound as each wheel goes over it this has been fixed many times before and it’s already a problem yet again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99-101, High Street, Goddington, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hertford Road, between Southfield Road and Northfield Road in front of the old Telephone Exchange Building. Overflowing bins and adjacent fly tipping, 7th November
item.description:
The bins are overflowing and people have fly tipped adjacent to the bins. There is evidence of street drinking as well. This is a disgraceful mess on our High Street. Please sort it out Enfield Council. It is bringing down the whole area and encouraging further antisocial behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, High Street, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
